content: मल {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [मृज्यते शोध्यते मृज्-कल टिलोपः <ls>Tv.</ls>] {@--1@} Dirty, foul. {@--2@} Mean, covetous. {@--3@} Unbelieving, infidel, godless. {@--4@} Wicked. --लः, --लं {@--1@} Dirt, filth, impurity, dust, any impure matter; मलदायकाः खलाः <ls>K. 2</ls>; छाया न मूर्छति मलोपहतप्रसादे शुद्धे तु दर्पणतले सुलभावकाशा <ls>Ś. 7. 32.</ls> {@--2@} Dregs, refuse, sediment, excrement, feces, dung. {@--3@} Dross (of metals), rust, alloy. {@--4@} Moral taint or impurity, sin. {@--5@} Any impure secretion of the body; (according to Manu these excretions are twelve:--वसा शुक्रमसृङ् मज्जा मूत्रविड् घ्राणकर्णविट् . श्लेऽमाश्रुदूषिका स्वेदो द्वादशैते नृणां मलाः <ls>Ms. 5. 135.</ls>). {@--6@} Camphor. {@--7@} Cuttle-fish bone. {@--8@} Tanned leather; a leather-garment. {@--9@} The three humours of the body (वात, पित्त and कफ). --लं A kind of base metal.
